metadata.name: private-analytical-workspace
metadata.description: This pattern module enables you to use Azure services that are typical for data analytics solutions. The goal is to help data scientists establish an environment for data analysis simply. It is secure by default for enterprise use. Data scientists should not spend much time on how to build infrastructure solution. They should mainly concentrate on the data analytics components they require for the solution.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group) to assign the role to.
Required. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. Sets the public IP addresses or ranges that are allowed to access resources in the solution.
Optional. The name of the existing Private Link Subnet within the Virtual Network in the parameter: 'virtualNetworkResourceId'.
Optional. Number of days data will be retained for. The default value is: '365'.
Optional. The workspace daily quota for ingestion. The default value is: '-1' (not limited).
Optional. The vault's create mode to indicate whether the vault need to be recovered or not. The default value is: 'default'.
Optional. Specifies the SKU for the vault. The default value is: 'premium'.
Optional. Switch to enable/disable Key Vault's soft delete feature. The default value is: 'true'.
Optional. Soft delete data retention days. It accepts >=7 and <=90. The default value is: '90'.
Optional. Provide 'true' to enable Key Vault's purge protection feature. The default value is: 'true'.
Optional. The name of the existing frontend Subnet for Azure Databricks within the Virtual Network in the parameter: 'virtualNetworkResourceId'.
Optional. The name of the existing backend Subnet for Azure Databricks within the Virtual Network in the parameter: 'virtualNetworkResourceId'.
Optional. You can use this parameter to integrate the solution with an existing Azure Virtual Network if the 'virtualNetworkResourceId' parameter is not empty.
Optional. Networks Access Control Lists. This value has public IP addresses or ranges that are allowed to access resources in the solution.
Optional. This parameter allows you to specify additional settings for Azure Log Analytics Workspace if the 'logAnalyticsWorkspaceResourceId' parameter is empty.
Optional. This parameter allows you to specify additional settings for Azure Key Vault if the 'keyVaultResourceId' parameter is empty.
Optional. This parameter allows you to specify additional settings for Azure Databricks if you set the 'enableDatabricks' parameter to 'true'.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Required. Name of the private analytical workspace solution and its components. Used to ensure unique resource names.
Optional. Location for all Resources in the solution.
Optional. The lock settings for all Resources in the solution.
Optional. Tags for all Resources in the solution.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Enable/Disable Azure Databricks service within the solution.

Optional. This option allows the solution to be connected to a VNET that the customer provides. If you have an existing VNET that was made for this solution, you can specify it here. If you do not use this option, this module will make a new VNET for you.
Optional. If you already have a Log Analytics Workspace that you want to use with the solution, you can specify it here. Otherwise, this module will create a new Log Analytics Workspace for you.
Optional. If you already have a Key Vault that you want to use with the solution, you can specify it here. Otherwise, this module will create a new Key Vault for you.
Optional. Array of users or groups who are in charge of the solution.
Optional. Additional options that can affect some components of the solution and how they are configured.

input.description: Full access to manage this resource, including the ability to assign roles in Azure RBAC.
Perform all data plane operations on a key vault and all objects in it, including certificates, keys, and secrets.

metadata.name: Virtual Networks
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. The Name of VNET Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be peer-localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. Do not verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
Optional. Deploy the outbound and the inbound peering.
Optional. The name of the VNET Peering resource in the remove Virtual Network. If not provided, default value will be peer-remoteVnetName-localVnetName.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. Do not verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
Required. The Name of the subnet resource.
Conditional. The address prefix for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefixes` is empty.
Conditional. List of address prefixes for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefix` is empty.
Optional. Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Optional. The delegation to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the NAT Gateway to use for the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the network security group to assign to the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private endpoint in the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. The resource ID of the route table to assign to the subnet.
Optional. An array of service endpoint policies.
Optional. The service endpoints to enable on the subnet.

Optional. Set this property to false to disable default outbound connectivity for all VMs in the subnet. This property can only be set at the time of subnet creation and cannot be updated for an existing subnet.

Optional. Set this property to Tenant to allow sharing subnet with other subscriptions in your AAD tenant. This property can only be set if defaultOutboundAccess is set to false, both properties can only be set if subnet is empty.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The name of the Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. Location for all resources.
Required. An Array of 1 or more IP Address Prefixes for the Virtual Network.
Optional. The BGP community associated with the virtual network.
Optional. An Array of subnets to deploy to the Virtual Network.
Optional. DNS Servers associated to the Virtual Network.

Optional. Resource ID of the DDoS protection plan to assign the VNET to. If it's left blank, DDoS protection will not be configured. If it's provided, the VNET created by this template will be attached to the referenced DDoS protection plan. The DDoS protection plan can exist in the same or in a different subscription.
Optional. Virtual Network Peering configurations.

Optional. Indicates if encryption is enabled on virtual network and if VM without encryption is allowed in encrypted VNet. Requires the EnableVNetEncryption feature to be registered for the subscription and a supported region to use this property.
Optional. If the encrypted VNet allows VM that does not support encryption. Can only be used when vnetEncryption is enabled.

Optional. The flow timeout in minutes for the Virtual Network, which is used to enable connection tracking for intra-VM flows. Possible values are between 4 and 30 minutes. Default value 0 will set the property to null.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Indicates if VM protection is enabled for all the subnets in the virtual network.

Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The name of the private endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the private endpoint to.
Optional. The name of the private link connection to create.
Required. The subresource to deploy the private endpoint for. For example "blob", "table", "queue" or "file".
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The private DNS zone group to configure for the private endpoint.
Optional. If Manual Private Link Connection is required.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with the manual connection request.
Optional. FQDN that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Specify if you want to deploy the Private Endpoint into a different resource group than the main resource.
Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Required. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, using 'latest'.
Optional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Required if no system assigned identity is available for use.
Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Required. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, using 'latest'.
Optional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Required if no system assigned identity is available for use.
Optional. Indicate whether the latest key version should be automatically used for Managed Disk Encryption. Enabled by default.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. Choose between HiveMetastore or UnityCatalog.
Required. The name of the Azure Databricks workspace to create.
Optional. The managed resource group ID. It is created by the module as per the to-be resource ID you provide.
Optional. The pricing tier of workspace.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The resource ID of a Virtual Network where this Databricks Cluster should be created.
Optional. The resource ID of a Azure Machine Learning workspace to link with Databricks workspace.
Optional. The name of the Private Subnet within the Virtual Network.
Optional. The name of a Public Subnet within the Virtual Network.
Optional. Disable Public IP.
Optional. The customer managed key definition to use for the managed service.
Optional. The customer managed key definition to use for the managed disk.
Optional. Name of the outbound Load Balancer Backend Pool for Secure Cluster Connectivity (No Public IP).
Optional. Resource URI of Outbound Load balancer for Secure Cluster Connectivity (No Public IP) workspace.
Optional. Name of the NAT gateway for Secure Cluster Connectivity (No Public IP) workspace subnets.
Optional. Prepare the workspace for encryption. Enables the Managed Identity for managed storage account.
Optional. Name of the Public IP for No Public IP workspace with managed vNet.
Optional. A boolean indicating whether or not the DBFS root file system will be enabled with secondary layer of encryption with platform managed keys for data at rest.
Optional. Default DBFS storage account name.
Optional. Storage account SKU name.
Optional. Address prefix for Managed virtual network.
Optional. The network access type for accessing workspace. Set value to disabled to access workspace only via private link.
Optional. Gets or sets a value indicating whether data plane (clusters) to control plane communication happen over private endpoint.
Optional. Determines whether the managed storage account should be private or public. For best security practices, it is recommended to set it to Enabled.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.

Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints for the managed workspace storage account, required when privateStorageAccount is set to Enabled. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Conditional. The resource ID of the associated access connector for private access to the managed workspace storage account. Required if privateStorageAccount is enabled.
Optional. The default catalog configuration for the Databricks workspace.
Optional. The value for enabling automatic cluster updates in enhanced security compliance.
Optional. The compliance standards array for the security profile. Should be a list of compliance standards like "HIPAA", "NONE" or "PCI_DSS".
Optional. The value to Enable or Disable for the compliance security profile.
Optional. The value for enabling or configuring enhanced security monitoring.
